questions.text: The ECG of a pregnant lady with the history of preeclampsia is shown below. Her vitals were stable. Next management is :
questions.explanation:
Solution:

IV MgSO4 The given ECG shows Torsades de pointes, a form of ventricular tachycardia in which QRS morphology twists around the baseline, may occur in the setting of severe hypokalemia, hypomagnesemia, or after administration of a medication that prolongs the QT interval. Torsades de pointes in the setting of hypomagnesemia can be treated with 1–2 g of magnesium sulfate in 10 mL of dextrose 5% solution pushed intravenously over 15 minutes. If patient is unstable then immediate defibrillation should be used.

questions.text: False statement/statements about the following image

options.label: A
options.text: It is the part of advanced life support

options.label: B
options.text: It only delivers a shock of 300J

options.label: C
options.text: One pad is applied over precordium and another over sternum

questions.explanation:
Solution:

All of the above It’s the image of automatic external defibrillator (AED) which is the part of basic life support. Since it’s automatic it is for the use of public. Apex pad is placed over precordium while sternal pad is placed right infraclavicular. If biphasic, it’s delivers the shock of 150-200 J and if monophasic it will deliver the shock of 360 J.

questions.text: True/False regarding the management of A 36 week primigravida female diagnosed with Transverse lie: a. Repeat USG to confirm the position b. Prepared for CS at onset of labor c. First breech part is extracted during CS d. Most probable cause in this is placenta previa e. Admit at 36 weeks
questions.explanation:
Solution:

a=True/b=True/c=True/d=True/e=False Transverse lie refers to a fetal presentation in which the fatal longitudinal axis lies perpendicular to long axis of the uterus. Prevalence - Approximately 1 in 300 delivery . Causes include - placenta previa , contracted pelvis , prematurity , hydramnios , abnormal uterine anomaly. In these cases we usually delivery by cesarean section. If the membranes are intact , and there’s no other complication we can also try external cephalic version where we externally rotate the fetus from breech presentation to cephalic presentation. If this fails then we go ahead with c-section.

questions.text: The given below instrument used in
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Cesarean section The above image is Doyen’s retractor. It is used to retract the abdominal wall as well as the bladder for proper exposure of lower uterine segment during LSCS.

questions.text: In Atonic PPH , which of the following is done : a. Uterine massage is first step in the management b. Suction of uterus c. IV Methyl Ergometrine is given to all patients d. B- Lynch suture is put if medical management fails

options.label: B
options.text: If a and c are correct

options.label: C
options.text: if b and d are correct

options.label: D
options.text: If all four ( a,b,c,d) are correct

questions.correct_answer: C. if b and d are correct

questions.text: IV loading dose of MgSO4 Prophylaxis in Pre-eclampsia is

options.label: D
options.text: 12 mL of MgSO4 + 8 mL of 0.9% NS

questions.correct_answer: C. 8 mL MgSO4 +12 mL of 0.9% NS
questions.explanation:
Solution:

8 mL of MgSO4 + 12 mL of 0.9% NS MgSO4 is the drug of choice in treating eclampsia- There are two regimens mainly followed : Pritchard regimen: Loading dose - 4gms of 20% MgSO4 slow iv , followed by 10 gms of 50% MgSO4 , 5 gms in each buttock Maintenance Dose – 5 gm (50%) in 4 hourly in alternate buttock. Zuspan or SIBAI : Loading dose 4gm iv slow . NS over 15-20 mins) Maintenance dose - 2gm iv infusion If convulsion recurs - 2gm iv bolus mgso4 is given If seizure still occurs Phenobarbitone is given Zuspan Regimen: Loading dose – 4 gm of 20% Mg SO4 IV Maintenace dose – 1-2 gm/im IV

questions.text: Anti D prophylaxis administered in all of the following conditions except
questions.correct_answer: D. Intrauterine blood transfusion at 28 weeks
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Intrauterine blood transfusion at 28 weeks The anti D vaccine is not given after Intrauterine Transfusion at 28 weeks. The infusion of RBCs into the fetus is an indication essential modality for the treatment of fetal anemia. Since, there is no maternal exposure to fetal antigens in this procedure, the use of anti – D is not required.

questions.text: True or false regarding PPH: a. Obese is a risk factor b. Previous PPH is a risk factor c. Active management of third stage of labor controls PPH d. Golden hour of PPH starts after full cervical dilation
questions.explanation:
Solution:

a=True/b=True/c=True/d=False Risk factors for PPH : Grand multipara Polyhydramnions and macrosomia APH fibroid obesity Precipitate labor Previous h/o PPH Active management of third stage of labor - Placental separation is actively facilitated and uterine contraction are initiated to reduce the incidence of third stage complications like PPH. Use of oxytocin after the birth of baby is recommended by WHO. Dose- 10 units IM or IV infusion - First 60 minutes from the time of recognition of PPH is the golden hour.

questions.text: Assertion: To define anaemia in pregnancy, low cutoff of Hb is taken than the non-pregnant scenarios. Reason: Physiological hemodilution is seen in pregnancy.

options.label: A
options.text: Both Assertion and Reasons are independently true / correct statements and the Reason is the correct explanation for the Assertion

options.label: B
options.text: Both Assertion and Reasons are independently true / correct statements, but the Reason is not the correct explanation for the Assertion

options.label: C
options.text: Assertion is independently a true / correct statement, but the Reasons is independently a false/ incorrect statement

options.label: D
options.text: Assertion is independently a false / incorrect statement, but the Reasons is independently true / correct statement

questions.correct_answer: A. Both Assertion and Reasons are independently true / correct statements and the Reason is the correct explanation for the Assertion
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Both Assertion and Reasons are independently true / correct statements and the Reason is the correct explanation for the Assertion During pregnancy there is increase plasma volume than increase in red cell mass leading to hemodilution . This hemodilution serves to reduce maternal blood viscosity , thereby enhancing placental perfusion and facilitating nutrient and oxygen delivery to fetus. Anemia during pregnancy is defined as Hb concentrations of less than 11gm % and a hematocrit of less than 33% . According to ICMR anemia classified into -
